text.text: Reflection and Next Steps
Congrats, you made it to the end of the engagement section!
Chapter takeaways:

Remember, the relationships you have, and continue to build, with community members/groups throughout the ERB process will be instrumental to the implementation of equitable actions. Engage your community throughout the ERB process to ensure you can utilize the relationships to inform the project later on. Keep in mind that communities are all unique - tailor the approach to your community.
Reflection:
Take a minute to think about what you accomplished in this chapter. Reflect upon and discuss the following questions, either individually or with your core team:
What went well with your initial community engagement plan implementation?
What was a challenge in developing your community engagement process? How will you overcome it?
Who have you engaged that may not have been included in previous planning processes?
How will you maintain relationships over the long-term?
How have you addressed issue of equity with your engagement plan?
What challenges did you encounter in initial engagement? How did you/will you address these challenges?
Next steps:

Now that you've reflected, make any adjustments to your community engagement plan or project plan that may be needed. (Remember, it's okay to make changes!) Continue to contact community members and set dates for any engagement sessions you planned.

Centering Equity

As you reflect on everything you've achieved in this section, you may also want to gather feedback from people you've started to engage. Are they clear about what you've asked of them, or what information you've shared? Do they have suggestions for deepening your engagement and reaching those hard-to-reach members of your community?
